Analysis of mosaic variants;

Mutations in DNA accumulate during lifespan of an individual resulting in mosaic body where each cell has its private variants in the genome. This is called somatic mosaicism. Despite of its commonness
column2: studying somatic mosaicism has been limited by lack of means to detect such variants at single-cell level. Recent advances in single cell genomics make it possible. Our group develops new computational methods for precise detection of somatic mosaic variants harnessing new experimental approaches such Next-gen sequencing. By applying the methods to human samples

column4: which involves determining mutation rates during human development
column5: the difference in numbers and patterns of mutations between tissues and between development stages
column6: the relationships of somatic mutations to disease
